item.title: 法国银行调查显示法国经济增长可能已经加速
item.description: 法国中央银行的一项调查显示，法国经济在经历了半年的勉强增长后，第一季度可能略有加快。【原文：The French economy probably notched up slightly faster growth in the first quarter after half a year of barely expanding, according to a survey by the country’s central bank.】

item.title: 法国总统阿塔尔称欧盟与加拿大的贸易协定是 "双赢 "协议
item.description: 法国总理加布里埃尔-阿塔尔（Gabriel Attal）在访问渥太华期间为欧盟与加拿大的贸易协议辩护，称尽管在参议院遭遇挫折，但他相信该协议将在法国取得进展。【原文：French Prime Minister Gabriel Attal defended the European Union’s trade deal with Canada during a visit to Ottawa, saying he had faith it would move forward in his country despite a setback in the Senate.】

item.title: 少数欧洲央行官员需要更多说服才能支持按兵不动
item.description: 2024年4月11日星期四，德国法兰克福，欧洲中央银行（ECB）行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）在利率决议新闻发布会上。欧洲央行在第五次会议上维持利率稳定，同时发出了迄今为止最明确的信号，即通胀降温将很快允许欧洲央行开始削减利率。摄影师：亚历克斯-克劳斯/布鲁姆伯格【原文：Christine Lagarde, president of the European Central Bank (ECB), at a rates decision news conference in Frankfurt, Germany, on Thursday, April 11, 2024. item.title: 汇丰银行和巴克莱银行为泰晤士河水务公司做空做市

item.title: 阿斯利康股东投票赞成支付首席执行官 1,900 万英镑薪酬
item.description: 阿斯利康公司（AstraZeneca Plc）股东支持帕斯卡尔-索里奥（Pascal Soriot）加薪，他已经是英国富时 100 指数中薪酬最高的公司首席执行官。【原文：AstraZeneca Plc shareholders backed a pay increase for Pascal Soriot, who is already the highest paid chief executive officer of a company in the UK’s FTSE 100 stock index.】

item.title: 德意志银行称美联储 12 月前不会首次降息
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）的经济学家们加入了越来越多的预测者行列，在消费者价格指数连续第三个月以快于预期的速度上升后，他们纷纷调低了对美国降息的预期。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG’s economists joined the growing crowd of forecasters who are dialing back expectations for US interest-rate cuts after the consumer-price index rose at a faster-than-expected pace for a third straight month.】

item.title: 福特降价引发电动汽车担忧，Rivian、Lucid 眼看创新低
item.description: 在福特汽车公司下调电动皮卡价格后，电动汽车初创企业 Rivian Automotive 公司和 Lucid Group 公司的股价周四跌至历史最低点。【原文：Shares of electric vehicle startups Rivian Automotive Inc. and Lucid Group Inc. are staring down all-time lows Thursday after Ford Motor Co. slashed prices on its electric pickup truck.】

item.title: S&P 公司称，越来越多的公司一再违约
item.description: 根据 S&P 全球评级公司（S&P Global Ratings）的最新报告，不止一次拖欠债务的公司比例达到了 2008 年以来的第二高水平。【原文：The percentage of companies that have defaulted on their debt more than once has reached its second highest level since 2008, according to a new report from S&P Global Ratings.】

item.description: 波兰总统安杰伊-杜达（Andrzej Duda）与乌克兰总统沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelenskiy）讨论了向乌克兰捐赠更多苏联解体后防空导弹的事宜，因为乌克兰正遭受着猛烈的空袭。【原文：Poland’s President Andrzej Duda has discussed donating more post-Soviet air defense missiles to Ukraine with President Volodymyr Zelenskiy as his country comes under intense aerial assault.】

item.description: 越来越多的借款人利用信贷市场的持续反弹，将他们从直接贷款机构获得的贷款换成华尔街银行提供的更实惠的债务。【原文：Borrowers are increasingly swapping loans they received from direct lenders for more affordable debt from Wall Street banks, capitalizing on an ongoing rally in credit markets.】

item.description: Destiny XYZ 是一家新推出的基金，其股价自 3 月底以来已暴涨了约 500%，投资者在评估这种能轻松进入一些著名私人控股科技公司的工具的价值时，会发现它是一个 "发现过程"。【原文：The surge in Destiny XYZ, a newly launched fund whose shares have exploded some 500% since late March, is a “discovery process” as investors gauge the value of a vehicle offering easy access to some prestigious privately held technology firms.】

item.title: 政治分歧迫使法国放弃能源目标法
item.description: 由于反对核能和可再生能源的人士在法国议会中出现政治分歧，法国放弃了将中期能源目标写入法律的计划。【原文：France dropped a plan to write medium-term energy targets into law amid a political rift between opponents of nuclear and renewable energies in the nation’s parliament.】

item.title: 挪威财富基金负责人称降息步伐将令市场失望
item.description: 挪威1.6万亿美元主权财富基金的负责人尼古拉-坦根（Nicolai Tangen）认为，持续的通货膨胀很可能会阻止全球央行迅速采取一系列降息措施。【原文：Persistent inflation is likely to prevent a rapid series of interest-rate cuts by global central banks, according to Nicolai Tangen, the chief of Norway’s $1.6 trillion sovereign wealth fund.】

item.title: 刚果就实施钴出口限制征求外部意见
item.description: 刚果（金）是世界上最大的钴生产国，它正在听取国际行业组织关于提高电池金属价格的建议，包括可能的出口配额。【原文：The Democratic Republic of Congo, the top cobalt producer, is sounding out advice from international industry organizations over measures to raise the battery metal’s price, including through potential export quotas.】

item.title: 德国林德纳称欧洲无需进一步举债
item.description: 德国财政部长克里斯蒂安-林德纳（Christian Lindner）表示，在各国的财政状况恢复正常之前，欧盟不应该为更多的项目提供资金。【原文：The European Union shouldn’t fund further programs until countries have gotten their finances in order, German Finance Minister Christian Lindner said.】

item.title: 萨尔瓦多发行宏观挂钩债券重返债务市场
item.description: 萨尔瓦多正在重返全球债务市场，提出了一项双重报价，其中包括一项将向投资者支付更高利率的债券，除非政府能够赢得信用升级或与国际货币基金组织达成协议。【原文：El Salvador is returning to global debt markets with a dual-tranche offer, including a bond that will pay investors a higher interest rate unless the government can win credit upgrades or a deal with the International Monetary Fund.】

item.title: 生产问题和天气影响收入，皮博迪公司业绩下滑
item.description: 美国最大的煤矿公司皮博迪能源公司（Peabody Energy Corp.）警告称，由于澳大利亚煤矿的生产问题和美国需求疲软，该公司第一季度的销售额将低于预期，随后该公司股价暴跌。【原文：Shares of Peabody Energy Corp. slumped after the biggest US coal miner warned that first-quarter sales will be lower than expected due to production issues at mines in Australia and weak demand in the US.】

item.title: 西格纳公司的本科面临列支敦士登欺诈和洗钱调查
item.description: 奥地利大亨雷内-本科（Rene Benko）和他的一家公司因涉嫌破产欺诈和洗钱而面临列支敦士登检察官的调查。【原文：Austrian tycoon Rene Benko and one of his companies faces a probe by Liechtenstein prosecutors into suspected insolvency fraud and money laundering.】

item.title: 泰晤士水务债务危机：会被国有化吗？账单会受到影响吗？
item.description: 英国最大的供水和污水处理供应商泰晤士水务公司（Thames Water）陷入困境。巨大的财务漏洞正威胁着该公司的临时国有化，可能会给当前或未来的政府带来巨大的麻烦。以下是关于泰晤士水务公司如何陷入困境、如果公司倒闭会发生什么以及这一切对客户意味着什么的解释。【原文：The UK’s largest water and sewage supplier Thames Water is in trouble. A huge hole in its finances is threatening to drive the company to temporary nationalization, potentially creating a big problem for current or future governments. Here’s an explainer of how Thames Water came to be in this position, what could happen if the company collapses and what it all means for customers.】

item.title: 大型银行财报将考验股市的反弹势头
item.description: 在过去六个月里，美国最大的银行股一路飙升，超过了 S&P 500 指数的涨幅。但进入财报季，它们能否保持这一势头是个大问题。【原文：The biggest US bank stocks have soared over the past six months, outpacing the S&P 500’s gains. But whether they can maintain that momentum is the big question entering earnings season.】
